shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 4ra-194rb) I-1) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi ... "Does not the man ..." (fols. 2r-3v l.28) I-2) Sǝbḥat läki Maryam bä-ḫwǝlqwä kwǝllu śǝʿǝrtǝyä ... "Glory to you, Mary, as numerous as my hair ..." (fol. 3v l.28-33) I-3) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 4ra-9rb) I-4a) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 120 miracles (fols. 12ra-171vb) I-4b) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 10 miracles (fols. 175ra-194rb)
Additiones 1-4.

copyists.copyist: Text I-4b is written in the same hand as quire I of Ms. BGY-013, where he is referred to as scribe and commissioner (fol. 8vb; the note is somewhat unclear).

donors.donor: The name of the original donor, ʾAser (e.g. fol. 85vb), has been erased from many supplication formulas throughout Text I-4a. Instead, the name of Ḫaylä Śǝllase and names of his family members (e.g., his father Gäbrä Maryam or his mother Säbänä Giyorgis) were added in hand a. Ḫaylä Śǝllase is also mentioned at the end of Text I-2.

owners.owner: According to Additio 1, the owner is ʾabba ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ (?).

dcomments.dcomment: Mid-15th - mid-16th cent. (?) Fols. 1 and 172-174, meant as endleaves, originate from a 15th-cent. Synaxarion. The miniature fol. 11 also originate from a different, late 14th or 15th-cent. Ms. Fols. 2-3 and fols. 175-194 are of recent time (possibly 20th cent).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was probably resewn. The back board has been broken and repaired. The leather cover is torn off from the back board and the spine. The endleaves (fols. 1, 173, 174) originate from a different codex and were cut to the size of this Ms. Fols. 2 and 3 are of different shape and were added later. Fols. 175-194 are loosely attached to the textblock (between endleaves and backboard). Local parchment repair with small pieces of parchment on fols. 9v, 10r. Holes or tears amended on fols. 55, 130.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover is poorly visible (at least 5 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, cross hatching, double sine wave with dots, double crescent with eye).

bnothers.bnother: Remains of endband stitches are visible on the spine fold of the quires. Quires I, VII and B are reinforced with parchment guards. The guard of quire B is made out of a folio originating from a different codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (hand a: deep vermillion; hand b: strong red, hand c: crimson).

squires.squire:
<A(3; s.l.: {1}, stub after 3; {2}, stub before 2; {3}, stub after 1/fols. 1r-3v)> – I(8; s.l.: {8}/fol. 4r-11v) – II(8/fols. 12r-19v) – III(8/fols. 20r-27v) – IV(8/fols. 28r-35v) – V(8/fols. 36r-43v) – VI(8/fols. 44r-51v) – VII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – VIII(8/fols. 60r-67v) – IX(8/fols. 68r-75v) – X(8/fols. 76r-83v) – XI(8/fols. 84r-91v) – XII(8/fols. 92r-99v) – XIII(8/fols. 100r-107v) – XIV(8/fols. 108r-115v) – XV(8/fols. 116r-123v) – XVI(8/fols. 124r-131v) – XVII(8/fols. 132r-139v) – XVIII(8/fols. 140r-147v) – XIX(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XX(8/fols. 156r-163v) – XXI(8/fols. 164r-171v) – {B(3/fol. 172r-174v)} – <XXII(20/fols. 175r - 194v)>
The structure of quires I, B and XXII cannot be determined.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: 20th century. Hand b: 17th century (?). Hand c: 20th century.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: uneven Hand b: fine and regular. Hand c: careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: Texts I-1 and I-2. The handwriting is uneven due to the lack of ruling. Many letters have short hairlines. Hand b: Texts I-3 and I-4a. Finely shaped, tall, slender, broadly spaced and slightly right-sloping letters; most of the numerals are written in ancient forms. Hand c, Wäldä Śǝllase (?): Text I-4b. Small letters with short hairlines. Many letters have forked hook vowel markers (e.g., ብ, ን, ገ).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-4b, alternating with black lines; a few lines on the incipit page of Texts I-3 and I-4a; initial lines of sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; titles in the upper margin; abbreviated directives for the ministers; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; Ethiopic numerals (hand b) or their elements (hand c).

abbreviations.abbreviation: Fol. 4r: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ Throughout Text I-4b: ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text I-3 is preceded by: - Ṣälotä zä-yǝtbähal ʾǝmqǝdmä yǝtnäbbäb täʾamriha lä-ʾәgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam ... "Prayer recited before reading the Miracles of our Lady Mary ..." (fols. 4ra-?).
All miracles of Text I-4a are numbered.

additional.det: The note is written in the main hand. The name of the owner (written over erasure, ʾabba ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ?) has been washed out.

additional.cont: Fol. 9va-vb: List of witnesses for the land ownership in Mǝkwǝˁat Märet.
additional.det: It lists witnesses involved in a dispute over land ownership (s. Additio 4). The scribe Kiros mentions himself at the end of the note.

additional.cont: Fol. 10ra-va: ˀƎsäggəd läki wä-ˀəweddəsäki ... "I worship Thee ...".
Fol. 171vb: Record concerning land donation.
additional.det: The note is written in a 17th-cent. (?) crude hand. The donor ʾAmätä ʾAb refers to her land donation to the church, which is given similarly to the land of Mǝkuʾat Märet given for the commemoration of ʾabunä ʾAbǝyä ʾƎgziʾ by Queen(?) Ğän Mängǝśa during the reign of her father Dawit (II).

extras.extra: - Endleaves fols. 1, 172, 174 are fragments of an old 15th-cent. (?) Synaxarion, containing parts of commemorative notices for: 22 and 23 Ḫǝdar (Cosmas and Damian, Cornelius); 8 Taḫśaś (Esi and Thecla, Samuel); 7 and 8 Taḫśaś (Samuel, Barbara and Juliana, Mathew). - The first strophe of Text I-1 is repeated in the upper margin of fol. 13v, in hand a. - Titles of most of the miracles of St Mary (Text I-4a) are written in the upper margin of the miracle's incipit page, in red. - Corrections are written over erasures: e.g., fols. 13rab, 33rb, 48ra, 69rb, 90va, 93rb, 149rb, 157va, 165va, 171rb. - A note has been erased from fol. 9rb, below Additio 1. - Several lines have been erased from fol. 77rb. - Sketches for ornamental bands on fols. 21va, 28rb, 34va, 49ra; probably in hand a. - Spaces for rubricated names of the donor are left unfilled throughout Text I-4b. - Crude drawings on fol. 173rv.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - In Text I-4b, readings are indicated by the names of the feasts, written in the upper margin: ዘልደታ: fol. 175ra አመ፡ ፫ለታሕሣሥ፡በዓታ: fol. 176va ዘልደት: fol. 178rb ዘአስተርእዮ: fol. 179va ዘደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ: fol. 180vb, in a secondary hand (pencil) ዘጽዮን: fol. 186ra ዘፍልሰታ: fol. 187ra ዘትስብእት፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፱ለመጋቢት: fol. 187vb.

miniature.details: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘከመ፡ ጸለየት፡ ቀዊማ። "Image of our Lady Mary. How she prays standing." The miniature is protected by a textile curtain. The miniature originates from an early 15th-cent. manuscript.

frames.frame: Fol. 4r (incipit page of Text I-3): coloured (green, red and black) ornamental band with one pendant reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs. Fol. 12r (incipit page of Text I-4a): coloured (green and red) ornamental band with one pendant reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces,zoomorphic and floral motifs. Fol. 14vb, 146ra, 150rb: short coloured (red and black) ornamental bands.
